Executive Summary

This is the 2018 Updated Risk Management Plan (RMP) for the Univar Solutions USA, Inc. 

(Univar) branch located at 8500 W 68th St, Bedford Park, IL, 60501-1844 (0913 Warehouse).



It is to satisfy the requirements of the Federal Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions in the 

Federal Code of Regulations (40 CFR Part 68). The RMP registration required under Section 68.160 of the Federal regulations is included in Appendix D.



Univar Solutions USA is a wholesale chemical distributor serving several U.S. industries. Founded 

in 1924, Univar supplied the food industry, chemical compounders, pharmaceuticals, mining, forest 

products, oil and gas producers, electronics, coatings, and many other critical sectors with the 

chemical raw materials and support services required or refine products used in numerous end-use 

markets.



Some of the products stored and handled by the Branch are subject to the Federal RMP regulations. 

Therefore, a vital requirement of this program is the preparation and submission of an RMP. The 

Federal EPA prescribes the content of the RMP.



The current required 5-year update includes one process for formaldehyde. Therefore, the basis for 

the following modification includes formaldehyde warehousing, which is a Program 3 process.



Univar Solutions USA Inc. has opted out of the RMP coverage exclusion for formaldehyde under 40 CFR 

68.115(b)(1). Despite the fact that the partial pressure of the material in the solution is less than 10 

millimeters of mercury (mm Hg), Univar Solutions USA Inc. has elected to keep the warehousing of formaldehyde in the current 5-year update regulated process.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Univar Solutions USA Inc.'s accidental release prevention program covers areas such as design, 

installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at the Branch, which demonstrates the facility's

commitment

to reducing the potential for accidental releases. In addition, it is the





Branch's policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated 

substances.



This program includes provisions and requirements for the critical elements listed in Section 1.4.



The Stationary Sources and the Regulated Substances Handled



The Branch's primary activities encompass the warehouse storage of industrial chemical raw 

materials and products and their distribution via Univar Solutions USA Inc.'s fleet of trucks.



The following branch processes are the subject of this Plan and hereafter are referred to as the 

covered processes for Warehousing Operations (Container Storage and Distribution): formaldehyde 

(37% or less by weight).

Five-Year Accident History



Univar Solutions USA Inc. has not had an emergency involving the covered processes that caused 

deaths, injuries, or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place within the last five 

years.



Emergency Response Program



In an emergency involving regulated substances, Univar Solutions USA Inc. developed a written 

emergency response plan to handle and address accidental releases of hazardous materials. The 

the emergency response plan includes adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, 

notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, and post-incident decontamination 

of affected areas.



This Plan is shared with local emergency responders who have access to branch personnel (and up-to-date phone numbers). The Branch responds to minor incidents but calls in professional 

emergency responders in all other incidents.



Local emergency responders, such as the fire department, are invited and encouraged to visit and familiarize themselves with the products and facilities. Joint emergency exercises are conducted 

when possible.

For more detail, see Section 6.0.
